headers.name: Content-Type
headers.description: Send JSON object to use the API Web Services

headers.name: X-chkp-sid
headers.description: Session unique identifier as it returned by the login request

body.name: name
body.description: Object name. Must be unique in the domain.

body.name: permission-type
body.description: The type of the Permissions Profile.

body.name: edit-common-objects
body.description: Define and manage objects in the Check Point database: Network Objects, Services, Custom Application Site, VPN Community, Users, Servers, Resources, Time, UserCheck, and Limit.Only a 'Customized' permission-type profile can edit this permission.

body.name: access-control
valid_values: By Selected Profile In A Layer Editor

body.name: show-policy
body.description: Select to let administrators work with Access Control rules and NAT rules. If not selected, administrators cannot see these rules.

body.name: policy-layers
valid_values: By Selected Profile In A Layer Editor

body.name: edit-layers
body.description: "By Software Blades" - Edit Access Control layers that contain the blades enabled in the Permissions Profile."By Selected Profile In A Layer Editor" - Administrators can only edit the layer if the Access Control layer editor gives editing permission to their profiles.
valid_values: By Selected Profile In A Layer Editor

body.name: app-control-and-url-filtering
body.description: Use Application and URL Filtering in Access Control rules.Available only if edit-layers is set to "By Software Blades".

body.name: content-awareness
body.description: Use specified data types in Access Control rules.Available only if edit-layers is set to "By Software Blades".

body.name: firewall
body.description: Work with Access Control and other Software Blades that do not have their own Policies.Available only if edit-layers is set to "By Software Blades".

body.name: mobile-access
body.description: Work with Mobile Access rules.Available only if edit-layers is set to "By Software Blades".

body.name: dlp-policy
body.description: Configure DLP rules and Policies.

body.name: geo-control-policy
body.description: Work with Access Control rules that control traffic to and from specified countries.

body.name: nat-policy
body.description: Work with NAT in Access Control rules.

body.name: qos-policy
body.description: Work with QoS Policies and rules.

body.name: access-control-objects-and-settings
body.description: Allow editing of the following objet types: VPN Community, Access Role, Custom application group, Custom application, Custom category, Limit, Application - Match Settings, Application Category - Match Settings, Override Categorization, Application and URL filtering blade - Advanced Settings, Content Awareness blade - Advanced Settings.

body.name: app-control-and-url-filtering-update
body.description: Install Application and URL Filtering updates.

body.name: install-policy
body.description: Install Access Control Policies.

body.name: manage-policies-and-software-deployment
body.description: The administrator can work with policies, rules and actions.

body.name: edit-endpoint-policies
body.description: Available only if manage-policies-and-software-deployment is set to true.

body.name: policies-installation
body.description: The administrator can install policies on endpoint computers.

body.name: edit-software-deployment
body.description: The administrator can define deployment rules, create packages for export, and configure advanced package settings.Available only if manage-policies-and-software-deployment is set to true.

body.name: software-deployment-installation
body.description: The administrator can deploy packages and install endpoint clients.

body.name: allow-executing-push-operations
body.description: The administrator can start operations that the Security Management Server pushes directly to client computers with no policy installation required.

body.name: authorize-preboot-users
body.description: The administrator can add and remove the users who are permitted to log on to Endpoint Security client computers with Full Disk Encryption.

body.name: recovery-media
body.description: The administrator can create recovery media on endpoint computers and devices.

body.name: remote-help
body.description: The administrator can use the Remote Help feature to reset user passwords and give access to locked out users.

body.name: reset-computer-data
body.description: The administrator can reset a computer, which deletes all information about the computer from the Security Management Server.

body.name: events-and-reports
valid_values: app control and url filtering reports only

body.name: smart-event
body.description: 'Custom' - Configure SmartEvent permissions.
valid_values: app control and url filtering reports only

body.name: events
body.description: Work with event queries on the Events tab. Create custom event queries.Available only if smart-event is set to 'Custom'.

body.name: policy
body.description: Configure SmartEvent Policy rules and install SmartEvent Policies.Available only if smart-event is set to 'Custom'.

body.name: reports
body.description: Create and run SmartEvent reports.Available only if smart-event is set to 'Custom'.

body.name: smart-update
body.description: Install, update and delete Check Point licenses. This includes permissions to use SmartUpdate to manage licenses.

body.name: lsm-gw-db
body.description: Access to objects defined in LSM gateway tables. These objects are managed in the SmartProvisioning GUI or LSMcli command-line.Note: 'Write' permission on lsm-gw-db allows administrator to run a script on SmartLSM gateway in Expert mode.

body.name: manage-provisioning-profiles
body.description: Administrator can add, edit, delete, and assign provisioning profiles to gateways (both LSM and non-LSM).Available for edit only if lsm-gw-db is set with 'Write' permission.Note: 'Read' permission on lsm-gw-db enables 'Read' permission for manage-provisioning-profiles.

body.name: vsx-provisioning
body.description: Create and configure Virtual Systems and other VSX virtual objects.

body.name: system-backup
body.description: Backup Security Gateways.

body.name: system-restore
body.description: Restore Security Gateways from saved backups.

body.name: open-shell
body.description: Use the SmartConsole CLI to run commands.

body.name: run-one-time-script
body.description: Run user scripts from the command line.

body.name: run-repository-script
body.description: Run scripts from the repository.

body.name: manage-repository-scripts
body.description: Add, change and remove scripts in the repository.

body.name: cme-operations
body.description: Permission to read / edit the Cloud Management Extension (CME) configuration.Not supported for Multi-Domain Servers.

body.name: manage-admins
body.description: Controls the ability to manage Administrators, Permission Profiles, Trusted clients,API settings and Policy settings.Only a "Read Write All" permission-type profile can edit this permission.Not supported for Multi-Domain Servers.

body.name: management-api-login
body.description: Permission to log in to the Security Management Server and run API commands using these tools: mgmt_cli (Linux and Windows binaries), Gaia CLI (clish) and Web Services (REST). Useful if you want to prevent administrators from running automatic scripts on the Management.Note: This permission is not required to run commands from within the API terminal in SmartConsole.Not supported for Multi-Domain Servers.

body.name: manage-sessions
body.description: Lets you disconnect, discard, publish, or take over other administrator sessions.Only a "Read Write All" permission-type profile can edit this permission.

body.name: high-availability-operations
body.description: Configure and work with Domain High Availability.Only a 'Customized' permission-type profile can edit this permission.

body.name: approve-or-reject-sessions
body.description: Approve / reject other sessions.

body.name: publish-sessions
body.description: Allow session publishing without an approval.

body.name: manage-integration-with-cloud-services
body.description: Manage integration with Cloud Services.

body.name: monitoring
body.description: See monitoring views and reports.

body.name: management-logs
body.description: See Multi-Domain Server audit logs.

body.name: track-logs
body.description: Use the log tracking features in SmartConsole.

body.name: app-and-url-filtering-logs
body.description: Work with Application and URL Filtering logs.

body.name: https-inspection-logs
body.description: See logs generated by HTTPS Inspection.

body.name: packet-capture-and-forensics
body.description: See logs generated by the IPS and Forensics features.

body.name: show-packet-capture-by-default
body.description: Enable packet capture by default.

body.name: identities
body.description: Show user and computer identity information in logs.

body.name: show-identities-by-default
body.description: Show user and computer identity information in logs by default.

body.name: dlp-logs-including-confidential-fields
body.description: Show DLP logs including confidential fields.

body.name: manage-dlp-messages
body.description: View/Release/Discard DLP messages.Available only if dlp-logs-including-confidential-fields is set to true.

body.name: policy-layers
body.description: Configure Threat Prevention Policy rules.Note: To have policy-layers permissions you must set policy-exceptions and profiles permissions. To have 'Write' permissions for policy-layers, policy-exceptions must be set with 'Write' permission as well.

body.name: edit-layers
body.description: 'ALL' - Gives permission to edit all layers."By Selected Profile In A Layer Editor" - Administrators can only edit the layer if the Threat Prevention layer editor gives editing permission to their profiles.Available only if policy-layers is set to 'Write'.
valid_values: By Selected Profile In A Layer Editor

body.name: edit-settings
body.description: Work with general Threat Prevention settings.

body.name: policy-exceptions
body.description: Configure exceptions to Threat Prevention rules.Note: To have policy-exceptions you must set the protections permission.

body.name: profiles
body.description: Configure Threat Prevention profiles.

body.name: protections
body.description: Work with malware protections.

body.name: install-policy
body.description: Install Policies.

body.name: ips-update
body.description: Update IPS protections.Note: You do not have to log into the User Center to receive IPS updates.

body.name: client-certificates
body.description: Create and manage client certificates for Mobile Access.

body.name: edit-cp-users-db
body.description: Work with user accounts and groups.

body.name: https-inspection
body.description: Enable and configure HTTPS Inspection rules.

body.name: ldap-users-db
body.description: Work with the LDAP database and user accounts, groups and OUs.

body.name: user-authority-access
body.description: Work with Check Point User Authority authentication.

body.name: user-device-mgmt-conf
body.description: Gives access to the UDM (User & Device Management) web-based application that handles security challenges in a "bring your own device" (BYOD) workspace.

    "publish-sessions" : true,

    "management-logs" : "write",
